body.p: "The U. S. CHRISTIAN COMMISSION sends this sheet as a messenger between the soldier and his home. Let it hasten to those who wait for tidings."

Barracks No 1
Feb 8 /65.
To Hon Thos. E. Bramblett
Sir

I take the liberty of addressing a few lines to you to See if you can do any thing for me my Case is as folllows after we the 13th Ky CavalryInfantry came here from the front to be mustered out and after we turned over our guns and equipments another man and I had a difficulty no one Killed or Seriously wounded but a little hurt he is well and gone home I was arested and placed in the prison here. I had a Court Marthial and have not received any Sentence yet
as I have Served my Country three years and four months and never was punished before I Should like you to do all you can for me in this matter hoping you will do all you can for me

I remain
your obt Servant
Col Warren
Barracks Prison No 1
Louisville
Kentucky

Barracks Prison No. 1.
Louisville Ky
Feby. 8" 1865
Warren Col
To the Gov.
Days after his Regt. the 13" Ky Infy was mustered out he had a dificulty with a man, and was arrested. Can you not do something for him --
Refer to Post coming to Louisville

L B_No_10_1865. P. 7
Recd A. G. O. Ky 9 Feby 1865
